headline: Fish Tacos
description: These fish tacos are easily made with fried beer-battered cod, served in crispy corn tortillas with shredded cabbage and a zesty seasoned white sauce.

video.description: See how to make 5-star San Diego-style fish tacos.
video.name: Fish Tacos

name: Fish Tacos
recipeIngredient: 1 pound cod fillets, cut into 2 to 3 ounce portions
2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, or more as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Make beer batter: Combine flour, cornstarch, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl. Blend beer and egg in a separate bowl, then quickly stir into flour mixture until combined with a few lumps remaining.

Make white sauce: Mix together yogurt and mayonnaise in a medium bowl. Gradually stir in fresh lime juice until consistency is slightly runny. Season with jalape√±o, capers, cayenne, oregano, cumin, and dill.
Start fish tacos: Heat oil in a deep-fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Dust fish pieces lightly with flour. Set aside.
Dip floured fish pieces into beer batter. Set aside.
Fry in hot oil until crisp and golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Lightly fry tortillas in hot oil until just crisped, but not too crisp. Drain on paper towels.
Place fried fish in tortillas; top with shredded cabbage and white sauce.

review.reviewBody: We found the fish to be slightly bland by itself but all of that changed once we drizzled the white sauce over the top! I cut the cayenne pepper in half and omitted the jalape√±o since our young kids can‚Äôt handle spicy food. I think next time I‚Äôll try grilling or baking the fish as a healthier option, but the fish is definitely good fried!
Bombest üí£ I ever made and hubby loved it live cooking new things from this sites

Best Baja taco sauce ever. I also lived in San Diego and when I moved back home to the Midwest I knew I needed more fish tacos. As soon as I saw your flavor profile I knew you had nailed it. I have been using your recipe since 4/2005! Now all of SE Wisconsin uses it too.
very good - just like in Old Mexico... Make some Pico de Gallo to give it a kick!

Ten years later I find myself coming back to this recipe. I substituted the cayenne for smoked paprika, the yogurt for sour cream, added salt to the fish. Served with a cabbage slaw dressed with lime juice, cilantro and salt. My dh said tasted better than at the Mexican place we like.

The white sauce is amazing!! I baked Schwan's frozen beer battered cod fillets instead of using the steps in the recipe. I had the fillets on hand, so just used them. But my husband and I loved the sauce! Will definitely be making this again.

I loved them. White sauce was a little spicy for my wife, but she said not to bad though. I used Tilapia fillets since that's what I had on hand. Definitely will do this again but cut back on the ground red pepper. Should have taken pics but sadly did not. To busy eating them.üòÅ
I made the white sauce but left out the capers (I‚Äôm not a fan). The sauce is excellent. I add a bit more cayenne pepper as I really like the spice.
The sauce is yummy!! We used flounder and saut√©ed with lime and olive oil. Added avocado to our tacos. Delicious!
Yummy!! I love this recipe very much. Thanks for posting.
Amazing recipe !!!! My husband gave it a 10 out of 10!!! For beer I used modelo
Delicious batter, dressing, and all together tasty fish tacos.

Instead of the garnishing in the recipe I used Pico de Gallo and also used spinach instead of the cabbage, I also used a small amount of mozzarella cheese between the spinach and fish. I have never heard of caper before this but I couldn‚Äôt even tell what it tasted like because you don‚Äôt notice it. REALLY good. Will make again.
Easy recipe. Tasty breading. The sauce is a bit on the spicy side, but I like that. I tried to grill this fish, but it didn‚Äôt work. Frying was perfect. Not greasy at all.

So delicious! I loved the crunch of the batter and the warmth of the sauce from the jalapenos! I added carrots shredded to the cabbage and made it into a slaw though. Was delicious! Making this again!!
It was delightful and I also learned how to make my own fish tacos now. Something I don't buy when I'm out now Thanks for the recipe.
These were so good, so tasty and very flavourful

I modified the fish batter by adding more beer and make it more watery. I coated the fish with fry flour mix then coated with the wet batter. The fish turned out really great! Thank you for the recipe!!
Great
it was good
Amazing ! The combination is perfect made it twice now and it‚Äôs simple and delicious!

It's a really good recipe. I've been making beer battered Baja style fish tacos and burritos for years and have never had anyone that didn't absolutely love them. I made this recipe primarily to try the white sauce. It was decent but I'll tell you my secret. I never tell anyone the secret ingredient before they try them, only after. I use regular thick whole fat greek yogurt! Usually Fage brand if you can find it. I spread a thin to medium thin coat inside the tortillas. This particular brand reminds me of a really thick sour cream but with that tartness to it that gives a WOW reaction. Don't go putting big scoops on the tacos like you might with sour cream.
I substituted wild Alaskan cod. Really like the yogurt chipotle sauce and was pleasantly surprised to easily find the canned chipotles in sauce at my grocery store in the Mexican food section.
I make this dish all time exactly as described . My family just loves it. Highly recommend
The only change I made was to add more dill and capers. I do not like or eat fish except for this awesome recipe. Enjoy
Outstanding.
Turned out great! I was a bit skeptical of the batter as I prefer a simple flour and beer mixture, but it works well. the white sauce is fabulous.

I think the white sauce should be combined with the cabbage and some vinegar and sugar to make more of a coleslaw to go with the fish. The fish was excellent. That batter was spot on! Great weeknight meal.

Will be making these often! Made these for our weekly movie night at my sister‚Äôs. My husband ate 2 tacos before we got there. Had to taste test. He ate them with just the sauce & cabage on the fish. He couldn‚Äôt have loved these more. My sister was really impressed. They went very fast! They were fun to make. I followed the directions exactly and put out all the toppings and put out 2 kinds of beans, and some rice.Lots of compliments on the sauce. Lots it‚Äôs of compliments on the fish. Everything was perfect. His recipe is a winner! ?? ??
I've made these a few times already. They are really easy and the sauce is yum!

Incredibly light batter, fish was moist and flaky. My only suggestion to improve this is to salt the fish beforehand or it turns out slightly bland and you need even more of the sauce. Overall, this one is a keeper!
Thank you so so much for sharing! These were amazing! I changed the yogurt to sour cream, like one of the other commenters stated, and it was to die for! My kids loved it!!!! Thank you!!!
I loved this recipe so much I had left overs 3 times last week! I added some quick pickled red onions on top, highly recommend.
I didn‚Äôt use beer, used buttermilk. Was very good and hearty.

Ok. So my first time making fish tacos - HUGH HIT My family said just as good as a restaurant!! The sauce really makes the dish. I also made the taco slaw recipe from all recipes was a great addition. Definitely making again!!
I followed recipe exactly and it‚Äôs delicious. Will make it again. The sauce goes perfect with the fish.

I've never made fish tacos because I live in San Diego. You can get them from any restaurant or from any food truck in the county. But I will make these over and over again. The batter is delicious but the sauce is to die for! I added purple cabbage, cilantro and a squeeze of lime. I'd give more stars if I could.
The tacos came out great! That sauce was a real hit! I will definitely be making again!
Delish! I added a little Old Bay to the sauce. Fresh and perfect.
Uh-mazing!! The whole family loved it!
Delicious recipe, will add to the books
I was short on time so I just used frozen fish fillets but the sauce was awesome! I didn't use jalapeno and used fresh dill.

I loved the beer batter on the Ling cod. The sauce has potential but needs revision. 1 teaspoon of cayenne pepper and a jalapeno is way too much heat. I think a diced pickle instead of the jalape√±o and 1/8 teaspoon of cayenne pepper would be much better.

I am also from San Diego, I went to high school next to Rubio's #1 when it first opened in '83, and I have enjoyed 15-20 trips to Baja will many scrumptious fish tacos, which are a favorite of mine. This recipe is very good but not the most Baja style authentic, which is both very good and only mildly bad. It is great in the case of the sauce (definitely use crema/sour cream), which is similar but packs a much better flavor due to the added dill/cumin/oregano. It is fantastic. Using crema I made several spice variations with and without the cumin and dill and it was best as written with the slight addition of 1/2 Tbsp sugar and 1/4 tsp MSG. The batter is good but not great in my opinion and not authentic: it was too puffy and bread-y and hid the flavor of the fish. So I also did a taste test with this other beer batter recipe that turned out far better and more authentic: 2 tsp garlic powder, 1/2 teaspoon Mexican oregano , 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1 teaspoon yellow mustard, 1 teaspoon chicken bouillon, 1 cup beer, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1 cup all-purpose flour. I also added 1/4 tsp MSG. I also cut the size of the fish pieces way back to 1 - 1 1/4 oz pieces so they did not crowd the tortilla, cabbage, salsa and guacamole. Even without the corn starch these were very crunch. With my changes this was 6 stars!

I used lettuce instead of cabbage. I added chopped tomatoes and purple onion to the garnishes. I was out of yogurt but used sour cream. Great sauce! I think these tacos may be better than my husband‚Äôs. Thank you.
I skipped the batter step and just used frozen battered cod. The taco sauce is amazing!
Just made the sauce and it was excellent!
didn't like,
Love the sauce. I just made fish with Shore Lunch breading mix as we had it on hand. But this was great! I used catfish. Again...in the freezer and needed to use.
Loved it!!!!

I made these for dinner last night. My husband has eaten them 4 times since. He says he has never had fish tacos that are better than these. I also took some over to my neighbor who requested the recipe. The recipe is perfect. These are excellent. I don't own a deep fryer so I cooked them in oil on the stovetop.

The batter was a little too thick at first so I thinned it out with more beer. Perfect tacos! We doubled up the tortillas after warming them one at a time on a cast iron skillet and putting them in the oven to keep warm. Doubling them helps keep everything from falling apart.

Most of the reviews are rating how they changed the recipe to make it worth five stars.
Fortunately, I changed it as well so it was at least edible.
The original recipe has Way too much Cayenne for anyone with half a taste sense. A Teaspoon for four servings - really?
Fifty percent mayonnaise and fifty percent plain yogurt equals a heavy handed sauce that overwhelms any fish flavor remaining after copious seasoning.
I gave it two stars for listing the ingredients as a starting point, and because it didn't come across as authentic to the Old Country. The diferential to achieve five stars will be more balanced proportions.
Amazing! My family and friends absolutely love this recipe. I recommend making the sauce earlier in the day, instead of trying to do it all at once.
I used leftover batterfried fish and followed the rest of the recipe. The sauce was really good!
This recipe is fabulous as is. Outstanding! If you are going to make a bunch of changes just submit your own recipe!

I followed recipe except I accidentally put all spices in the white sauce in the beer batter. I scooped out most of it but some were still in it. It turned out tasty. I put a little more lemon juice than the recipe and the sauce came out so yummy. I will definitely make it again.

The batter was on the lighter side for me, the white sauce was phenomenal and I‚Äôll be using that on multiple different recipes. All said and done it was fresh, perfect for summer and a great way to incorporate fish into your diet.
Best fish tacos I‚Äôve ever had. I used rake fish (a white fish like rock fish).

This is the second time I've made this recipe and we love it. For me the cayenne-jalapeno proportions are just perfect, but for my spicy-averse husband they need to be reduced "about 20%." (Ha! Never!) I would steam the tortillas in the future so they could be wrapped around the fish and cabbage.
Made this almost per recipe minus some of the seasonings, didnt have everything but still turned out great. Added some cilantro and fresh mango. Muy bueno. Keep it classy
Great recipe! The batter is light and crispy. For the sauce, I used 1.5x of the seasoning the second time I made it. The 1.5x seasoning added more flavor for our taste.
First had these in MX. So pleased to find this recipe. makes excellent fish tacos. the sause is amazing.

Great recipe. The only thing I did differently is to forgo the batter and 
just grill the tilapia naked under the broiler. I make my own corn tortillas with Maseca brand masa and a tortilla press. They're easy to make and taste 10 x better than store bought. I have no picture because I ate the subject.

Ralph

This recipe was amazing! We decided to change the fried fish into a skillet version (salt and pepper to season; 2/3 to 1/3 mixture olive oil to butter; let rest in a lime juice covered plate). But the white sauce is DELICIOUS.

I made some changes on the fly, but the essence was there.
The white sauce was incredible. 
I don;t remember all the changes, but among them was using less beer, no Cayenne Pepper, just regular pepper, not an entire jalape√±o, only half of it. I used fresh oregano and fresh dill, instead of dry, since I had them in the garden.
And I did it with haddock instead of cod, because that was the best offer that day, and the fish that looked better.
And, a major one, lemons instead of limes. That could be considered a sin for this, but limes are not allowed in my kitchen for the moment, and lemons did fine.
And the most important conclusion: It came out great. One of the best fish tacos I have ever had.

The batter was supppppper light and crispy. I used negro modelo as the beer. I also omitted the capers and maybe that‚Äôs why my sauce wasn‚Äôt ‚Äúamazing‚Äù, but it was still good. I wound up using leftover sriracha mayo as my topping as well as homemade pico de Gallo instead of cabbage. Will be a go to recipe from now on.
I actually made the sauce to go with the fish tacos I usually make and it was awesome! Just enough kick and easy!

I have made this many times and get raves every time. I will admit to cheating, though. I use frozen battered fish filets and chop them up. Makes for a quick and tasty dinner. The sauce absolutely makes these fish tacos. They are a huge hit with me, my friends, and family!

My husband never comments on how good my food is without me asking him. When I made this dish, he said to me without me asking him anything, that it was restaurant quality! I made it for my parents also and they just loved it! My dad asked me when I was making it again.

OMGOSH this recipe is the bomb boom boom! Our entire family enjoy the batter on the cod deliciously yummy. Then there's the sauce, the sauce oh that sauce, now that was the biggest lift hit on those tacos. Our 11 yr old grandsonny who can be quite picky when it comes to certain spicy foods, enjoyed it along with the rest of the family in fact all were asking, where the fish sauce was! So, thank you for this smart, simple and quick dish!
I really enjoyed these. Will make again.
Amazing!!!!
We just had this tonight. Amazing. I'm going to grill it next time and see. That sauce is on point.

This is my go to fish taco recipe. I have made it for years and it is one of my husbands favorites. I use cod. The beer batter is perfect in my opinion and I absolutely love the sauce. I use whatever beer I have on hand and have never had an issue. If you follow the directions you will not be disappointed.
No we liked it like was

This recipe was a hit with the family and my girlfriends family. 
Delicious and easy to make. This is are go to fish taco meal!
I really enjoyed the fish tacos. I thought the breading was great and so was the white sauce. I will make these again.
This was amazing! I added cayenne pepper in batter. Nice subtle kick!
Made it with fresh catfish. This is a keeper. We really enjoyed the sauce, added extra cayenne pepper because we like some heat to our food. Will be making this again.
The batter was fluffy and crisp and the sauce was to die for.

Omg! This recipe was the best. My fish battered turn out so well. Light, golden and crunchy. The sauce was absolutely delicious. I substituted the yogurt for sour cream, which made it so amazing. From now on I will make my own batter this way when I fry fish but the tacos turned out well and my family loved it.
I made this last night only with flour tortillas. It was delicious. The sauce is fantastic. I fried tillapia in flour, egg and panko. Two were really filling
I made this last night only with flour tortillas. It was delicious. The sauce is fantastic. I fried tillapia in flour, egg and panko. Two were really filling

Good recipe! have quite a few recipes for fish tacos, and I like this variation pretty well. Not sure what part of ‚Äúthe south‚Äù submitter moved to, because I‚Äôve lived in ‚Äúthe south‚Äù my entire life and have always known about fish tacos. They are even served in many restaurants in the southern region of the US.

Made this just as written... by far the best fish taco recipe I have found. 
Thanks for sharing!

I made them with me putting the bare fish into the flour/beer mixture and just grilled on my cast-iron grill pan. I also did not use mayo (I hate it) sour cream and yogurt with minced garlic, coriander and chopped cilantro and a dash of salt!

I only gave it 3 stars because of the confusing preparation directions!
Amazing. Lots of work but best fish tacos EVER!!

These Tacos are SOOOO GOOOOD!! I used Rockfish that I got in my frozen fix box. The sauce MAKES these tacos stand out! I didn't have Jalape√±o so I used sriracha sauce for the kick of heat! Can't wait to make these again!!

Fantastic. I made the fish the day before , then baked it for 30 minutes when preparing the meal, to get a good crisp on the battered fish. I added garlic powder to the sauce. Those are my only additions. We will have this again.
I eliminated the capers, used cilantro instead of dill and used Chipotle chili pepper instead of cayenne ( allergic). MY SON SAID IT TASTED AUTHENTIC.
When I resided in Camp Pendleton, California, Fish Tacos Night was every Tuesday and Friday! My sons and I lived off this stuff! "It's All About The Sauce!!!"
I had saved this recipe previously and pulled it out and made and they were delicious. My son and I loved the sauce so well I made it again and doubled the recipe.
We here in Florida have been making them for years......but we make them with blackened grouper or red snapper or fresh shrimp from the gulf....we love them. Made changes on yours they were good.

Great recipe! I also lived in San Diego and have looked for this recipe for ages. I worked for Family Medicine and there was a little taco shop within walking distance that I used to go to for lunch. Same tacos!!! I am especially thankful for finding the recipe for white sauce since I cheat and use the Gortons Fried Fish with a little lime sprinkled on top of the cabbage and sauce! Thank you! Too back there isn't room for more stars!
Way way way too many ingredients!
Great taco
Not even close...!
Just made this last night. One substitution, grilled bacon wrapped shrimp instead of tacos. YUMMY!!!
